subject: Science
title: What Is Air Pressure?
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Is Air Pressure? usable.

hook.text: Right now, 10 tons of air are pressing down on you. You don't notice because you're used to it.

buildup.text: Air has weight. At sea level, it pushes with a force of about 1 kg per square cm.

discovery.text: When air heats up, it rises and pressure drops. When it cools, it sinks and pressure rises.

twist.text: Low pressure means rising air and storms. High pressure means sinking air and clear skies.

punchline.text: Falling pressure means storms are coming. A 400-year-old trick still works.
